III. It is not to be doubted but that the disciples of Christ did sufficiently abhor the acquiring of riches by fraud and rapine: but can we absolve all of them from the guile of it before their conversion? particularly Matthew the publican‘? And is it so very unseemly for our Saviour to admonish them to make themselves friends by restituam, and a pious distri- bution of those goods they may have unjustly gathered before their conversion? The discourse is about restitution, and not yiviny of abms.
